questions.question_text: Which is a consideration when creating a drill-to-detail dashboard component?

choices.C: The source report must be stored in the drill-to-detail folder.
choices.A: The dashboard component type must be a gauge.
choices.B: Drill-to-detail must be enabled on the custom report type.
choices.D: The source report must be grouped by record name, record owner, or feed post.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Record Detail Page
When you select the Drill Down to value as Record Detail Page, it will bring you to the details page for that record, depending on the area clicked on.

This option is available for the table component, and also valid for charts that use a source report grouped by record name, record owner, or feed post only.

Record Detail Page—When users click chart or table elements, axis values, or legend entries, they are taken to the detail page for that record. You can only choose this option for tables and charts that use a source report grouped by record name, record owner, or feed post. (Not available for gauges or metrics.)

questions.question_text: Which can be accessed by a Chatter Free user?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACDE
Chatter Free
The Chatter Free license is for users who don’t have Salesforce licenses but must have access to Chatter. These users can access standard Chatter items such as people, profiles, groups, and files, but they can’t, for security reasons, access any Salesforce objects or data.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.users_license_types_chatter.htm&type=5

discussion.content:

a master-detail is a stronger relationship where the child object is dependent on the parent object, whereas a lookup is a more loose relationship where the child object can exist without a parent.
